RESOLVED_ENTITIES.two Border Patrol agents: Jorge Luis Trevino and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent with nearly seven years of experience, stationed at the Freer checkpoint for a year and a half, familiar with ninety to ninety-five percent of the vehicles passing down FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Reymundo Reyes: Officer of the Freer Police Department who conducted a traffic stop on Ignacio Rodriguez's black truck, observed Ignacio Rodriguez's nervous behavior during the stop, and decided to impound the vehicle due to lack of insurance information and uncertainty about the vehicle's ownership, informed by Agent Benavides
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ: Border Patrol agents involved in the investigation of suspicious vehicles on FM 2050
